text: Achyranthes splendens (Ewa hinahina; also called Maui chaff flower, round chaff flower, round-leaf chaff flower, or round-leaved chaff flower) is a species of flowering plant in the pigweed family, Amaranthaceae, that is endemic to Hawaii. Its natural habitats are dry forests, low shrublands, and sandy shores. It is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== * Bruegmann, M.M. & Caraway, V. 2003. Achyranthes splendens. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 20 August 2007. splendens Category:Endemic flora of Hawaii Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Achyranthes splendens
